Authors: Benawa A., Ruman Y.S., Irawan I.
Title: Relevancy and Urgency of Religion Education on the Faithfulness Formation of the Students
Source title: IOP Conference Series: Earth and Environmental Science
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Mass Communication Program Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Character Building Development Center, Technic Information Program, School of Technic Information, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Benawa, A., Character Building Development Center, Mass Communication Program Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Ruman, Y.S., Character Building Development Center, Mass Communication Program Communication Department, Faculty of Economics and Communication, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Irawan, I., Character Building Development Center, Technic Information Program, School of Technic Information, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The main objective of this research is to observe the extent of students' understanding of Pancasila Education, especially the first principle, Ketuhanan Yang Maha Esa and Religion Education towards the formation of Faithfulness of the Students. For this reason the method used is a quantitative research method which is carried out by distributing questionnaires to the respondents and then completing it by using path analysis. The results showed that Pancasila Education, especially the First Principle has no significant influence. It can be seen on the amounted 34,30%, while the effect of Religion Education on the Faithfulness Formation of the students is significant, which amounted to 59.4%. It can be concluded that Pancasila Education has smaller significant effect on the Faithfulness Formation of the students than Religion Education, which has significant effect. From the results of this study it became clear about the study of what types of education had a significant influence on the formation of the Faitfulness of the students. And the implication is that Religion Education should be delivered more intensively and seriously if we idealized to format faitfulness of our students as the young generation. Therefore, the students as the young generation not only having religion, but they have to be religious and faithful persons. © 2020 IOP Publishing Ltd. All rights reserved.
Index Keywords: Regression analysis; Surveys; First principles; Path analysis; Quantitative research methods; Students
References: Benawa, The Effect of Pancasila Education and Civic Education on Nationalist Character of the Students (2019) Advances in Social Science, Education and Humanities Research, 353, pp. 347-351; Kansil, (1986) Pendidikan Pancasila di Perguruan Tinggi; Frederikus, F., (2017) Character Building Pancasila; Arcadius, B., (2016) Iman Tiga Dimensi-Model Beriman Secara Kritis; Magnis-Suseno, (1987) Etika Umum; Frederikus, F., (2015) Character Building Agama; Donald, A., Lucy Cheser, J., Asghar Reza, W., (1997) Introduction to Research in Education; Slovin, (2010) Principles and Methods of Research: Ariola et Al; Montgomery, D.C., (2012) Design and Analysis of Experiments
Conference name: 2nd International Conference on Environmental Geography and Geography Education, ICEGE 2019
Abbreviated Source Title: IOP Conf. Ser. Earth Environ. Sci.

Authors: Chairiyani R.P., Winiharti M., Irawan I.
Title: The use of Facebook for national integration by Bina Nusantara University students
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; English Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Character Building Development Center, Computer Science Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Chairiyani, R.P., Character Building Development Center, Primary Teacher Education Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Winiharti, M., English Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Irawan, I., Character Building Development Center, Computer Science Department, Faculty of Humanities, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: A number of young people in Indonesia has Facebook account as their social media. It is used not only to link to their friends but also to obtain information. However, the rapid development of Facebook use has not only a positive impact but also a negative one. One that should be a concern is that the truth of the information posted in Facebook is not always accountable. Several users are likely to trust the information posted even though it is not reliable. As a result, it is not uncommon that the information on Facebook can actually make the disintegration on the nation. Therefore, this study is conducted to describe how Facebook can be used by young people to make Indonesian nation more integrated. The informants are nine students of Bina Nusantara University who are selected randomly. The data are collected using interview technique based on nine relevant questions. Then the data are analyzed using the theory of Uses and Gratifications. The results show that social media such as Facebook can be used by university students as a tool to maintain and develop Indonesian's national integration. They can also manage not to allow such media to make the nation disintegrated. This result implies that when social media is used wisely and positively, it supports the nation for sustainable integration. © Published under licence by IOP Publishing Ltd.
Index Keywords: Disintegration; Integration; Students; Facebook; Indonesia; It supports; Social media; Sustainable integrations; University students; Uses and gratifications; Young peoples; Social networking (online)
References: Yusuf, O., (2016), Hampir Semua Pengguna Internet Indonesia Memakai Facebook Online Tekno.com; Zakaria, I., (2015), Remaja Indonesia Makin Tergantung Dengan Facebook Ketika Liburan Online Tekno.com; Basilisco, R., Cha, K.J., Uses and gratification motivation for using facebook and the impact of facebook usage on social capital and life satisfaction among filipino users (2015) International Journal of Software Engineering and Its Applications, 9, pp. 181-194; Sianipar, A.P., Pemanfaatan youtube di kalangan mahasiswa (2013) USU, 2; Ha, Y.W., Kim, J., Libaque-Saenz, C.F., Chang, Y., Park, M.C., Use and gratifications of mobile sns: Facebook and kakaotalk in korea (2014) Telematics and Informatics, 32 (3), pp. 425-438; Irianto, A.M., Integrasi nasional sebagai penangkal etnosentrisme di indonesia (2013) Humanika, 18, pp. 1-9; Haryono, B., Sulistyo, E.T., Zuber, A., Model pendidikan partisispatif empat pilar bangsa bagi integrasi nasional (2013) Komunitas, 5, pp. 240-251

Authors: Pane M.M., Ruman Y.S., Irawan I.
Title: The role of instant messaging in building virtual teamwork: A case study of character education in Binus University
Source title: Proceedings - 2017 10th International Conference on Human System Interactions, HSI 2017
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Management Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pane, M.M., Computer Science Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Ruman, Y.S., Management Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irawan, I., Computer Science Department, Character Building Development Center, BINA NUSANTARA University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Teamwork is considered as an important competency in the era of information technology. Communications are predominantly doing virtually. The study aims to measure the role of instant messaging in building vitual teamwork. The study posited convenience sampling technique and quantitative method-based applying the measurement of frequency for managing and interpreting the data. The respondents involved students of sophomores, 5th and 7th semester students. The study populated 120 respondents consisting of students from many department such as Information Technology, Psychology, Visual Communication Design-Animation, Business Law, and Information System, Accounting-IS, IS-Management, Accounting, International Relations, English Literature, Game Application Technology (GAT), and Marketing Communication. It measured the teamwork competencies performance of the respondents using the instant messaging using the Likert scale on the scale of 1 to 5. The performance is: scale 4 is chosen by 40.05% respondents, scale 3 is 29.35%, the scale 2 is 14.12%, the scale 5 is 12.27%, and the scale 1 is just chosen by 4.21% of respondents. The result of the study indicated that the role of instant messaging (IM) discorded with expected role. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Character education; Instant messaging; Virtual teamwork
Index Keywords: Animation; E-learning; Education; Information management; Marketing; Message passing; Visual communication; Application technologies; Instant messaging; International relations; Marketing communications; Quantitative method; Sampling technique; Virtual teamwork; Visual communication designs; Students
Funding Text 1: was supported by Bina Nusantara University

Authors: Benawa A., Laurentius L., Irawan I.
Title: Improving students’ learning motivation by increasing lecturer’s ability and learning model
Affiliations: CBMKU, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Benawa, A., CBMKU, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Laurentius, L., CBMKU, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irawan, I., CBMKU, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of the research is to study the effect of lecturer’s ability in managing class and learning model on student learning motivation. The research was conducted in Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta with a sample of 150 respondents selected randomly. This research used path analysis method. The result shows that there is positive direct effect of (1) lecturer’s ability in managing class, (2) and learning model, on the student’s learning motivation. The conclusion is (a) if lecturer’s ability in managing class is higher, it can increase student’s learning motivation; (b) if learning model is more precise, it can improve student’s learning motivation; (c) if lecturer’s ability in managing class is higher and the learning model is precise, student’s learning motivation can also be higher. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Learning model; Learning motivation; Lecturer’s ability

Authors: Ch R.P., Irawan I., Pane M.M.
Title: Self awareness mapping of Ubinus students toward the national culture based on the values of PANCASILA (3rd principle: Unity of Indonesia)
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Ch, R.P., Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irawan, I., Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pane, M.M., Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl. Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: Facing the globalization era, the younger generation should understand of the importance of self-awareness towards national culture based on the values of Pancasila, especially the 3rd principle. This study used qualitative research method, which is analytical description of the results of the written interview and FGD. This research aims to find the mapping/overview of self-awareness of BINUSIAN 2018 toward the national culture based on the values of Pancasila (3rd principle, Unity of Indonesia) and create instructional learning model, especially Pancasila values. © 2017 American Scientific Publishers All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Mapping/Overview; Self-Awareness; The Values of Pancasila (3rd Principle, Unity of Indonesia)

Authors: Patriana Ch R., Irawan I., Tampubolon S., Pane M.M.
Title: Benefits of using smartphones for improving students’ learning outcomes at BINUS University
Affiliations: Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Patriana Ch, R., Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia; Irawan, I., Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia; Tampubolon, S., Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia; Pane, M.M., Character Building Development Center, Universitas Bina Nusantara, Jl.Kemanggisan Ilir III No. 45, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to find out the benefits of using smartphones for improving students’ learning outcomes. This research was based on the quantitative approach and Baker’s theory on Smartphone usage (2005). Data collection was conducted by distributing questionnaires. The questionnaires were constructed by the researchers based on the theory of Baker (2005), involving 200 students of BINUS University. Data analysis was performed by Pearson correlation analysis. The results of this study are there is a positive correlation between portability and motivation (r = 0.335, p < 0.01), a positive correlation between collaboration and motivation (r = 0.342, p < 0.01). There is no correlation between age and motivation either no correlation between GPA and motivation (r = − 0.067, p > 0.05). These results are expected to give impacts on the teaching methods of the lecturers in order to help improve their students’ learning outcomes. © 2015 American Scientific Publishers.
References: Awaludin, W., (2014) Norma Generasi Internet, , https://www.selasar.com/kreatif/norma-generasi-internet; Barker, A., Krull, G., Mallinson, B., A proposed theoretical model for Mlearning adoption in developing countries (2005) Journal, , Department of Information Systems, Rhodes University, South Africa; Corbeil, J.R., Valdes-Corbeil, M.E., (2007) Are You Ready for Mobile Learning?, , Educause, No. 2, University of Texas, Brownsville; Gardner, J.C., (2011) Learning Motivation in Technology-Rich Training, , George Washington University, Washington, D.C; Granito, M.D., Chernobilsky, T., The Effect of Technology on Student's Motivation and Knowledge Retention (2012) NERA Conference Proceeding 2012.
